title: Lipid profile of regular kratom (Mitragyna speciosa Korth.) users in the community setting
title_html: Lipid profile of regular kratom (Mitragyna speciosa Korth.) users in the community setting

creator.name: Mohammad Farris Iman Leong Bin Abdullah

article_citation: Abdullah MFILB, Tan KL, Isa SM, Yusoff NS, Chear NJY, Singh D (2020) Lipid profile of regular kratom (Mitragyna speciosa Korth.) users in the community setting. PLoS ONE 15(6): e0234639. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0234639

authors.name: Mohammad Farris Iman Leong Bin Abdullah
authors.affiliation: Lifestyle Science Cluster, Advanced Medical and Dental Institute, Universiti Sains Malaysia

authors.name: Kok Leng Tan
authors.affiliation: Regenerative Medicine Cluster, Advanced Medical and Dental Institute, Universiti Sains Malaysia

authors.name: Salbiah Mohd Isa
authors.affiliation: Lifestyle Science Cluster, Advanced Medical and Dental Institute, Universiti Sains Malaysia

authors.name: Nur Sabrina Yusoff
authors.affiliation: Centre for Drug Research, Universiti Sains Malaysia

authors.name: Nelson Jeng Yeou Chear
authors.affiliation: Centre for Drug Research, Universiti Sains Malaysia

authors.name: Darshan Singh
authors.affiliation: Centre for Drug Research, Universiti Sains Malaysia

source.title: Fasting lipid profile and liver function test

source.description: All participants were told to begin fasting at 21:00 and then arrive at the Advanced Medical and Dental Institute (AMDI), USM at 09:00 the following day for blood collection (i.e., 12 hours of fasting).

source.title: Fasting lipid profile and liver function test

source.description: A blood sample was collected from each participant for fasting lipid profile (FLP) and liver function test (LFT). The blood collection was performed by a phlebotomist. These tests were conducted in an ISO 15189-certified laboratory at AMDI, USM.

source.title: Fasting lipid profile and liver function test

source.description: Blood samples were transferred to the laboratory within 1 hour, and the FLP and LFT analyses were carried out on the same day.

source.title: Fasting lipid profile and liver function test

source.description: Quantitative determination of serum triglyceride (TG), total cholesterol (TC), high-density lipoprotein (HDL), total protein (TP), albumin, alkaline phosphatase (ALP), alanine transaminase (ALT), aspartate transaminase (AST), total bilirubin (TB) and direct bilirubin (DB) were performed on a fully automated biochemistry analyser Beckman Coulter AU680. Whereas, globulin was determined from simple subtraction of albumin from total protein value, and indirect bilirubin was determined by subtraction of direct bilirubin from total bilirubin value. Low-density lipoprotein (LDL) was calculated via Friedwald equation.

source.title: Fasting lipid profile and liver function test

source.description: Total protein was quantified using biuret method which is traceable to National Institutes of Standards and Technology (NIST) Standard Reference Material (SRM) 972c.

source.title: Fasting lipid profile and liver function test

source.description: Albumin was quantified using bromocresol green method traceable to International Federation of Clinical Chemistry (IFCC) standard certified reference material (CRM) 470.

source.title: Fasting lipid profile and liver function test

source.description: For ALP, it was quantified using kinetic colour (pNP) method traceable to Beckman Coulter master calibration, whereas ALT and AST both were measured using kinetic UV method which are traceable to IFCC.

source.title: Fasting lipid profile and liver function test

source.description: Total bilirubin and direct bilirubin were quantified using photometric colour test (diazonium salt) which are traceable to Beckman Coulter master calibrator and NIST SRM 916a respectively.

source.title: Fasting lipid profile and liver function test

source.description: The results of TP, albumin and globulin were expressed in g/L; ALP, ALT and AST in U/L, and bilirubin in µmol/L.

source.title: Fasting lipid profile and liver function test

source.description: Quantitation of TG, TC and HDL level were determined using enzymatic color method.

source.title: Fasting lipid profile and liver function test

source.description: The method for TG and TC is traceable to isotope dilution mass spectrometry and NIST SRM 909b Level 1 respectively.

source.title: Fasting lipid profile and liver function test

source.description: For HDL, the method is traceable to the US Centre for Disease Control.

source.title: Fasting lipid profile and liver function test

source.description: All the findings of FLP were expressed in mmol/L.

source.title: Fasting lipid profile and liver function test

source.description: Calibration for all test methods were accomplished by the use of chemistry calibrator cat. 66300 except for HDL, a separate HDL-cholesterol calibrator ODC 0011 was used.

source.title: Fasting lipid profile and liver function test

source.description: Internal quality control procedure was undertaken immediately following calibration in accordance to good laboratory practice.

description: The protocol describe the steps involved in conducting fasting lipid profile and liver function test from the blood samples of regular kratom users and healthy non-kratom using subjects in this study. This tests were conducted in an ISO 15189-certified laboratory at Advanced Medical and Dental Institute, Universiti Sains Malaysia. The blood parameters which were determined quantitatively included serum triglyceride (TG), total cholesterol (TC), high-density lipoprotein (HDL), total protein (TP), albumin, alkaline phosphatase (ALP), alanine transaminase (ALT), aspartate transaminase (AST), total bilirubin (TB) and direct bilirubin (DB). While globulin was determined from simple subtraction of albumin from total protein value, indirect bilirubin was determined by subtraction of direct bilirubin from total bilirubin value, and low-density lipoprotein (LDL) was calculated via Friedwald equation.
